q: What is the main goal of CI?
o: To merge code changes frequently and automatically run tests

q: What is the main goal of CD (Delivery)?
o: To ensure code is always in a deployable state
GitHub's built-in CI/CD and automation platform

q: Where are GitHub Actions workflows defined?
What file format is used for GitHub Actions workflows?

o: A configurable automated process running one or more jobs
A set of steps in a workflow that run on the same runner
An individual task within a job (run command or use action)

q: What is 'on' in a workflow file?
o: The keyword to define events that trigger the workflow
Triggers workflow when code is pushed
Triggers workflow when a pull request is opened/updated
A standard runner image referencing the latest Ubuntu release
Keyword specifying the runner environment for a job
A standard action to check out the repository's code onto the runner
Executes command-line programs in the shell
Optional name for the workflow, job, or step (displayed in UI)
A server that runs your workflow jobs
Expression syntax for variables, secrets, and function calls
Automatically generated token for authentication in the workflow
Encrypted environment variables (keys, tokens) stored in repo settings

Defining the time schedule for a job

Execute a job or step only if condition is true
Defines dependency on other jobs (must finish first)
